cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 15 miles south of Cayo Largo, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: continuing WNW today, turning NW then NNW across the central and north-western Gulf of Mexico toward the Texas–Louisiana border coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-west Gulf Coast near the Texas–Louisiana border (south-west Louisiana coast)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas–Louisiana border eastward to Mississippi coast, including southeast Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 kt) possible with gusts approaching hurricane force as Laura nears landfall
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential storm surge 3–6 ft above ground level along Plaquemines Parish shoreline and lower Mississippi River
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with localized totals up to 12 inches possible, creating flash-flood risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands, dangerous surf and rip currents affecting port approaches
